case_vignette:
A 42-year-old man comes to his physician with a history of fever, non-bloody diarrhea, and headache for 10 days. He also complains of anorexia and abdominal pain. He returned from a trip to India 3 weeks ago. His temperature is 40.0°C (104.0°F), pulse is 65/min, respirations are 15/min, and blood pressure is 135/80 mm Hg. He has developed a blanchable rash on his chest and trunk. A photograph of the rash is shown. Examination of the heart, lungs, and abdomen show no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 15 g/dL
Mean corpuscular volume 95 μm3
White blood cell count 3400/mm3
Percent segmented neutrophils 40%
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a fever, non-bloody diarrhea, and headache for the past 10 days, and I also have a loss of appetite and abdominal pain.
Have you recently travelled or eaten anything out of the ordinary?
Yes, I returned from a trip to India 3 weeks ago.
Have you been in contact with anyone who is currently ill or was sick during your trip?
I can't say for sure; no one I directly know was sick, but I was traveling, so I might have come into contact with sick people.
Are you currently having any respiratory symptoms like cough or shortness of breath?
No, I'm not having any cough or shortness of breath.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you on any long-term medication?
The case vignette does not mention any existing medical conditions or long-term medications.
Have you noticed if anyone who traveled with you is experiencing similar symptoms?
The information about whether others who traveled with me are experiencing similar symptoms isn't provided.
Have you noticed any rashes, changes in skin color, or jaundice?
Yes, I have developed a rash on my chest and trunk that turns white when you press on it.
Do you have any allergies or a history of similar symptoms in the past?
The vignette doesn't mention any allergies or a history of similar symptoms.
Have you been drinking adequately filtered or bottled water during your trip, and did you receive any travel-related vaccinations prior to your trip?
The vignette does not provide details about my water consumption or travel-related vaccinations.
Final Diagnosis: Typhoid fever.
